name: echinacea tennesseensis
description: Recently removed from the federal endangered species list, Tennessee Coneflower is well worth having around. Flat, pastel pink flowers with green and burgundy centers follow the sun like sunflowers.  Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
